title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA canceled Hingham/Hull ferry service for February 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry service, operating from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal starting at 6:30 a.m.
Heavy snowstorm has led to increased ferry cancellations due to unusual ice thickness not seen in years.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The incident occurred on Wilder Street on February 5; Kennedy succumbed to his injuries at Lahey Hospital.
An investigation into the crash is ongoing, conducted by Middlesex DA, State Police, and UMass representatives.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas likely to start 2026 in Triple-A Worcester due to health concerns and increased competition at first base.
Kristian Campbell's defensive struggles may lead to starting 2026 with Triple-A Worcester, despite a promising early career.
Masataka Yoshida remains on the roster with limitations due to poor defense, impacting DH spot competition.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Hampshire officials knew of the ICE facility plan in Merrimack as early as January 12, ACLU documents revealed.
The proposed ICE detention center at 50 Robert Milligan Parkway will cost $158 million to renovate, with a 400 to 600 bed capacity.
Commissioner Sarah Stewart resigned following backlash over lack of communication regarding the ICE facility plans in New Hampshire.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell remains the New England Patriots' left tackle despite struggles in the Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Former Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia supports Mike Vrabel's decision to keep Campbell at left tackle for the 2026 season.
Ex-All-Pro tackle Terron Armstead offered to help Campbell address technique and power issues during offseason workouts.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel emphasized unity and future potential after the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
The Patriots lost 29-13 to Seattle, ending their successful 2025 season with 14 regular-season wins.
Vrabel praised the team's progress from a four-win season and remains optimistic about building on their foundation.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots promote defensive coordinator Terrell Williams to a 'high-ranking' role on Mike Vrabel's staff.
Williams is now cancer-free and may be replaced by linebacker coach Zak Kuhr as defensive coordinator.
Under Zak Kuhr, Patriots' defense ranked fourth in points allowed, aiding their Super Bowl LX run.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield, dragged by a car for a 'lengthy distance.'
Colbert was found dead on West Housatonic Street; the incident happened near Linden Street and Francis Avenue.
Police are searching for a dark-colored sedan involved in the incident and urging the public for information.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to the Seahawks 29-13, concluding a season after a previous 4-13 finish.
Ann-Michael Maye expressed gratitude and encouragement on Instagram despite Patriots' loss, highlighting the team's achievements.
Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record for most passing yards in a quarter, despite his shoulder injury.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon with Boston Children’s Hospital’s Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher's son, born with neurological issues, inspires his marathon run to honor the hospital's care and support.
He aims to raise awareness and funds for Boston Children's Hospital, highlighting treatments that have helped his son thrive.
